snippet: In its heyday, the base enabled Moscow to listen in on telephone conversations in the southeastern United States and communicate with its spies on American soil.
abstract: Russia decides to reopen an electronic eavesdropping post in Cuba that it closed more than a decade ago, reaching out for a onetime symbol of its global superpower status; in exchange, Russian Pres Vladimir Putin agrees to forgive about 90 percent of Cuba’s Soviet-era debt to Russia, or about $32 billion.
lead_paragraph: In its heyday, the base enabled Moscow to listen in on telephone conversations in the southeastern United States and communicate with its spies on American soil.

headline.main: Russia Plans to Reopen Post in Cuba for Spying
headline.print_headline: Russia Plans to Reopen Post in Cuba for Spying

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
